content: in this legal case mai is seeking to settle a claim with vm regarding the division of joint property mai proposes that a part of the property be divided with mai retaining sole ownership and vm receiving financial compensation the court orders vm to pay the costs of the proceedings and awards mai compensation for procedural costs vm raises objections to the claim and wants to submit a counterclaim the court gives vm a deadline to file their counterclaim throughout the procedure there are preliminary hearings and the submission of documents by both parties the court terminates the granting of legal aid to vm after examining the evidence the court determines that the claim must be satisfied the court considers the marriage and joint property relationship between vm and xxxx the acquisition of a part of the property during the marriage and the death of vm the plaintiff requests the division of the joint property with mai retaining sole ownership and vm receiving financial compensation the defendant accepts the claim but objects to the proposed division the court determines that the claim must be satisfied and orders the division of the joint property in the proposed manner the court also addresses the distribution of procedural costs ruling that vm must bear mais procedural costs the defendant is required to pay the awarded amount of procedural costs to the plaintiff the decision on the determination of procedural costs can be challenged by appealing to a higher court
